page.title: 06GROWING FOR A LIVING
page.content: La Rocque grower Mr Claud Bertram says, "My main crop is potatoes now that I have given up growing tomatoes." The light soil of this low-lying area suited the growing of outdoor tomatoes for export to the mainland, a trade which flourished for nearly a century. But Britain's entry into the Common Market brought continental competition and forced growers in the area into a mixed 'market-garden' type of horticulture. Mr Bertram has some large glasshouses. "In them I grow spray carnations and iris for export," he says. He also grows specialist crops such as calabrese and asparagus. Mr Bertram sells his asparagus to local restaurants. He keeps no cows but a few farmers in La Rocque do have small herds of Jerseys to supplement their incomes as growers.
